int32_t.name: count
int32_t.comment: number of elements used in array above

struct-type.comment: some festivals are annual, some single time. unk_1=0 plus unk_3=0 seems to match with single time, which doesn't make much sense. Only frequency seen is yearly

int32_t.name: unk_2
int32_t.comment: only -1 seen, but based on other cases, might be an abstract building

int32_t.name: unk_4
int32_t.comment: only seen with unk_3=2, but is usually not set

int32_t.name: reference
int32_t.comment: art form / event / item_type /procession start abstract building

int8_t.name: depot_notified
int8_t.comment: has it warned you that you need a depot

flag-bit.name: check_cleanup
flag-bit.comment: set each time a merchant leaves the map or dies

flag-bit.name: tribute
flag-bit.comment: caravan is delivering tribute (not merchant caravan)

int32_t.name: mood
int32_t.comment: reflects satisfaction with last trading session

int32_t.name: symbol_claim_id
int32_t.comment: different small numbers, but all claimed by the greedy necro diplomat, but not complete number range present

int32_t.name: claim_year
int32_t.comment: Written contents often seem to lack info of being claimed

int32_t.name: holder_hf
int32_t.comment: might be owner_hf. all cases encountered have had both field the same when claimed by entity

int32_t.name: unk_year
int32_t.comment: seems to be current year or -1. Matches up with corresponding field of artifact_record

struct-type.comment: The 3 first vectors are of the same length and somehow connected

int32_t.name: unk_v47_1
int32_t.comment: seen kobold thieves and goblin snatchers, but not all thieves... seen 1 of several persecuted and expelled

stl-vector.name: unk_v47_3
stl-vector.comment: some enum?

struct-type.bitfield: SiteGovernment and Outcast has this flag set when there are no site links with the residence or invasion_push_out flag set. Others (NomadicGroup, MilitaryUnit seen) have it set when the criteria of the first group are fullfilled together with occupation_failed, criminal_gang, and reclaim being absent as well, provided they have at least one site link (no site link = flag not set). Civilizations can have the flag set when having lost all sites, but usually do not, so the flag seems useless at that level (Some exterminated kobolds have it set, while most do not, for instance. Embark culled dwarven civs may or may not have it set).

stl-vector.name: guild_professions
stl-vector.comment: Only seen 1, and only for guilds

int32_t.name: id
int32_t.comment: Guess, but all are 0, and it matches the standard pattern

stl-vector.name: populations
stl-vector.comment: 1st entry copies to unit.population_id for Adventurer?

stl-vector.name: stones
stl-vector.comment: boulders and blocks

stl-vector.name: gems
stl-vector.comment: small and large cut

compound.name: glass_unused
compound.comment: used for vial extracts on embark

compound.name: wood_products
compound.comment: lye, charcoal, potash, pearlash, and coke

static-array.name: unk13
static-array.comment: in 0.23, these were material/matgloss pairs, never used for anything

stl-vector.name: unk14
stl-vector.comment: in 0.23, items that would be equipped by the arriving King, never used

stl-vector.name: art_image_types
stl-vector.comment: 0 = civilization symbol

stl-vector.name: foreground_color
stl-vector.comment: foreground color used for the entity symbol in legends mode and the historical maps.

stl-vector.name: background_color
stl-vector.comment: background color used for the entity symbol in legends mode and the historical maps.

stl-vector.name: known_sites
stl-vector.comment: only civs and site government. Fresh player site government has empty vector

stl-vector.name: worship
stl-vector.comment: Same length as deities(?). Some kind of relationship strength?

stl-vector.name: belief_systems
stl-vector.comment: In Religion type entities established by prophets after having developed their own belief system, the ID of this belief system is contained here.

stl-vector.name: constructions
stl-vector.comment: only civs. Usually pairs for source/destination, with destination lacking path and construction. Construction and second entry can be lacking when destination lost(construction destroyed as well?). Also seen only source entry

compound.name: path
compound.comment: set only for the first source/destination/construction entry in pairs

stl-vector.name: construction
stl-vector.comment: set only for the first (source) entry in pairs

int16_t.name: unk_1
int16_t.comment: 0 and 1 seen, paired with same value in the next field

int16_t.name: unk33
int16_t.comment: Non zero seen only on site governments (not all) and one nomadic group. Small values

stl-vector.name: unk34a
stl-vector.comment: same length as unk34b and unk34c

stl-vector.name: position
stl-vector.comment: position index (not id)

stl-vector.name: official
stl-vector.comment: holder of office of corresponding position index

int32_t.name: unk44a
int32_t.comment: appears to be a class with a constructor?

stl-vector.name: major_civ_number
stl-vector.comment: Single item increasing from 0 linearly as major race civs are created, i.e. all civs except cavern and Kobold, but including spire breach released goblin ones

stl-vector.name: major_civ_number_2
stl-vector.comment: Identical to major_civ_number on the same entries. Presumably some properties only major civs have, such as e.g. accepting outsiders as members, engage in conquest, etc.

stl-vector.name: unk_1
stl-vector.comment: Only on major civs, but not all

pointer.name: occasion_info
pointer.comment: only seen on Civilization, SiteGovernment, and Religion, but not all

stl-vector.name: artifact_claims
stl-vector.comment: sorted on artifact id

stl-vector.name: honors
stl-vector.comment: Only merc companies. Matches #Honors groups in Legends Viewer

int32_t.name: total_battles
int32_t.comment: attacks + defenses. Only seen on military units

stl-vector.name: foiled_plot_agreements
stl-vector.comment: Mostly a guess. The foiled plot agreement out of 2 appeared here

stl-vector.name: divination_sets
stl-vector.comment: Guess. Only on religions, but not all. start at 350 and added sequentially in Religion formation order. Last religion # = last divination set index

int32_t.name: founding_site_government
int32_t.comment: All cases examined refered to site government of site of founding. Perf troop and merc lack site info but seems reasonable.

int32_t.name: offerings_recent
int32_t.comment: since the last migrant wave or diplomat visit

stl-vector.name: children
stl-vector.comment: includes self

struct-type.compound:
-- Civ entities. Nil for sites. -- Civ entities. Non pointers for sites.
? ? ?
?

stl-vector.name: unk_1
stl-vector.comment: maybe probability?

stl-vector.name: unk_5
stl-vector.comment: not saved

int32_t.name: unk_6
int32_t.comment: unknown size, not initialized or saved

enum-item.name: Armor
enum-item.comment: metal.armor, also used for shields, tools, instruments, and toys

enum-item.name: Metal
enum-item.comment: metals with ITEMS_HARD, used for chains

int32_t.name: unk_1
int32_t.comment: can't find match. not defender hf/nemesis, for instance

int32_t.name: first_settler_hf
int32_t.comment: strangely enough not expedition leader (settler #2), nor listed as member of site government

int32_t.name: unk_year
int32_t.comment: often the same as the other year/tick. Start/stop time?

flag-bit.name: petition_not_accepted
flag-bit.comment: this gets unset by accepting a petition

enum-item.name: PositionCorruption
enum-item.comment: Embezzlement and accepting bribes seen. For own gain and for 'sponsor'

int32_t.name: position_id
int32_t.comment: position index in the entity's Own entity_position vector

int32_t.name: influencer_index
int32_t.comment: agreement.parties index. May be swapped with beneficiary

stl-vector.name: intermediary_indices
stl-vector.comment: agreement.parties index

int32_t.name: intermediary_index
int32_t.comment: agreement.parties index. A guess, as no intermediary cases have been seen

stl-vector.name: criminal_indices
stl-vector.comment: agreement.parties index. All indices listed, regardless of confessions

int32_t.name: tier
int32_t.comment: 1 = temple or guildhall, 2 = temple complex or grand guildhall; matches location_tier in abstract_building_contents

int32_t.name: action
int32_t.comment: 8 and 9 seen. Probably matches up with corresponding hist fig Infiltrate_Society action

int32_t.name: unk_1
int32_t.comment: only same as fool_id seen, and so may be swapped. Guess it would be sentencer if different from fooled hf, though
